info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-platform-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for monitoring of platform components.
     Copyright (c) 2016-2017, 2019, 2021-2022 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Platform & Hardware
**Paths:** 5

**YANG Model:** [Cisco-IOS-XE-platform-oper.yang](https://github.com/YangModels/yang/blob/main/vendor/cisco/xe/17181/Cisco-IOS-XE-platform-oper.yang)

get.description: Enclosing container for the components in the system
List of components, keyed by component name (collection)
List of components, keyed by component name
List of components, keyed by component name (collection)
List of components, keyed by component name

temp-instant.description: Instantaneous temperature value of a component

temp-avg.description:
Arithmetic mean value of the statistic over a
         sampling period

temp-max.description:
High water mark value of the statistic over a
         sampling period

temp-min.description:
Low water mark value of the statistic over a
         sampling period

temp-interval.description: The time interval over which the min/max/average statistics are computed by the system

alarm-threshold.description: Threshold value above which system generates an alarm

type.description: Type of component as identified by the system

id.description:
Unique identifier assigned to the component
         by the system

mfg-name.description:
System-supplied identifier for the manufacturer of the
         component.  This data is particularly useful when a
         component manufacturer is different than the overall
         device vendor

version.description:
System-defined version string for a hardware, firmware,
         or software component

serial-no.description: System-assigned serial number of the component

part-no.description:
System-assigned part number for the component.  This should
         be present in particular if the component is also an FRU
         (field replaceable unit)

empty.description: If true, the component is empty

removable.description: If true, the component is removable

temp-instant.description: Instantaneous temperature value of a component

temp-avg.description:
Arithmetic mean value of the statistic over a
         sampling period

temp-max.description:
High water mark value of the statistic over a
         sampling period

temp-min.description:
Low water mark value of the statistic over a
         sampling period

temp-interval.description: The time interval over which the min/max/average statistics are computed by the system

temp.description:
Temperature in degrees Celsius of the component. Values include
         the instantaneous, average, minimum, and maximum statistics. If
         average/minimum/maximum statistics are not supported, the target is expected
         to just supply the instant value

alarm-threshold.description: Threshold value above which system generates an alarm

comp-alarm-data.description: Temperature alarm data of a component

comp-mem-data.description: Available and utilized memory of a component

configurable.description: Indication of whether the property is user-configurable
